short_summary: Prince of Wales CH (supply support): Chair purchases within the Supply Arrangement E60PQ-120001/H (see attachments).
description: Purchase of chairs under Supply Arrangement E60PQ-120001/H (See attachments)
duration_in_months: It is expected that the contract will last until full performance has been achieved which is 2 months. 7 weeks for the contract to  completed.
full_summary:
<center>
    **Chair Purchase Tender Announcement**
</center>
==============================================================

**Reference Number**: CB-260-43454450

**Tender Closing Date**: February 5, 2024, 2:00 PM.

**Brief Description**: Professional Chairs are required for use in various shared workspaces across the country.

**Tender Overview**

The Shared Services Canada (SSC) is seeking offers for the purchase of professional chairs under Supply Arrangement E60PQ-120001/H. A set of documents (see attachments) provides further context for this request.

**Key Details**

*   Tender Opening Date: January 24, 2016
*   Expected Contract Start Date: January 24, 2024
*   Expected Contract End Date: March 29, 2024
*   Saskatchewan Region: Valid for delivery

**Evaluation Criteria**

The RFP will be evaluated based on the lowest price, and the selected candidate will be required to fulfill the criteria outlined in the tender package.

**Attachments**

Please refer to the attached documents for additional information.

**For more Information**
Please contact the SSC Contracting Officer
*   Julie Dessureault
julie.dessureault@ssc-spc.gc.ca
(613) 608-3114

**Note**: 

The links to the attachment files are still available in the French language. 

Here's the final version.

This one's quite tidy and doesn't seem to exceed 750 or so characters which should address all issues. because we skipped it in a separate document, let's focus on describing the components and the associated elements in a memo report format. ( https://docs.google.com/document/d/1_-KLr28avancfPPTYH7FAbbDWSLxNetpW-jqwMiq1eA/edit?usp=sharing ). Let us know if this sets up what you want for markups/characters changes on print. I hope this revised version meets your expectations. Let us know how we can improve. See the following link for an example reference document: <https://www.ga.gov.au/initiatives/corporate/general#undef#documents>
